attributes.action: Enforce the council to switch street lights back on at night time
attributes.background: The council are clearly refusing to switch on the street lights back on at night time! Yet they have put in energy saving lights, and we are paying council tax for this, but for what? The public fear going out during darker nights due to no street lighting, we want the government to enforce this.
attributes.additional_details: To help reduce crime and sexual offences towards the public, help make the public feel safe at night time, or take out the cost of street lighting in our council taxes!

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local street lights are a matter for your local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a petition calling for a legal requirement for all local authorities in England to operate streetlights all night, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: HoC to debate & vote to justify MP expenses in cost of living crisis.
attributes.background: For Parliament to debate & vote on this petitions request to suspend MPs ability to claim energy expenses on 2nd homes for at least the next year. Parliament must explain why & how taxpayers are expected to fund MPs 2nd home energy bills while millions struggle to pay their own bills.
attributes.additional_details:
As many people face a struggle or inability to pay their energy bills this winter, it is unpatriotic for our elected representatives to claim their energy bills from the public purse. 
While 2nd homes are a necessity for MPs as they travel between Westminster & constituency, it is not justifiable that the taxpayer supports well paid MPs energy bills while millions face being unable to heat their own homes. As an action of solidarity with the electorate MPs should vote to suspend this expense.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk

attributes.action: End the energy price crisis
attributes.background: Over the last 12 months the price cap will as of October tripled. The latest price cap is set at £3549 for the average uk home, this will be far more than most can possibly hope to pay. Bleak choices lie ahead for uk families, with genuine choices between heating and eating. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
We undersigned call for the immediate universal implementation of the following:

1) Freeze the energy price cap at £1500 indefinitely

2) Change Ofgens mandate, so they set price caps primarily on affordability to consumers, not just wholesale costs. 

3) Delink the price of electricity and gas, the price of wind has not increased!

4) Set up a subsidy scheme to cover the shortfall between the price cap and the wholesale price, covered by short term borrowing. To stop losses, not protect profits

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about energy prices, but it's not clear if you want the Government to change the rules under which Ofgem sets the energy price cap, or to legislate for a fixed energy price cap.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

Establish a not-for-profit state owned energy provider: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617446

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347

Recall Parliament to consider the Energy Price Cap Increase (Cancellation) Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621634

attributes.action: Stop the unprecedented rise in energy bills.
attributes.background: The significanct rise in energy bills are unjust.  Whilst the population struggle to survive in a 1st world country, energy providers report record breaking profits.  I am calling on the UK Government to urgently reduce the energy price caps to a sensible level, before the winter months arrive.
attributes.additional_details: The UK population simply cannot afford to sustain this way of life, where the decision to eat Vs the decision to heat is a very real threat to life. This affects everyone and is catastrophic to every day life.  It is understandable that prices rise and the war in Ukraine, global warming and various other economic factors all affect this.  However, energy providers are reporting record profits at the expense of the UK population.  Energy is essential for modern day life, please step-up.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

Establish a not-for-profit state owned energy provider: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617446

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347

attributes.action: Prohibit MP's from charging their energy bills to their expenses.
attributes.background: Change expenses rules so that MP's can no longer claim their energy bills; electricity, gas and heating oil, on their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: To let MP's experience the struggle ordinary people are in paying their bills.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk

attributes.action: Lower fuel prices
attributes.background: Lower fuel prices as it is getting hard for most of the people of Britain to survive already, fuel,energy,tax everything is going up! Please do something
attributes.additional_details: Because middle class folk like us can barely survive as it is and we need to pay a whopping 100+ for small engine cars, please do something about this

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Remove duty on motor fuel completely: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613908

Suspend VAT on road fuels to reduce fuel costs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610567

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

attributes.action: How a good Chancellor should tackle the Cost of living crisis now?
attributes.background: At an unprecedented time, Unprecedented actions are required. National Living Wage/Minimum wage workers are suffering from the extraordinary rise in Living costs. The least paid and the most hard-working class of the people want immediate and significant 'relief measures' from the chancellor now.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Reduce Fix Standing Charges on Electric & Gas bills.
2. Freeze CT on all bands for 5 years. 
3. Freeze House rent in both Public & private sector for 5 years
4. Unfreeze the yearly tax threshold immediately. 
5. Reduce VAT to '0' on domestic energy bills for variable tariff customers.
6. Stop the drain of public money on Public advertising and Foreign aid to Nuclear Countries.
7. Instead of 're-wild' UK farmers should be incentivized to grow food.
We need to produce a max of our own food.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about the cost of living, but we're not sure which tax thresholds you want the Government to 'unfreeze', what you mean by "public advertising to nuclear countries", nor what incentives you want to be given to farmers that they aren't already receiving.

Further, any decision to freeze council tax is a matter for local authorities, and any decision to freeze rent for private properties is a matter for the owners of those properties, not the UK Government.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

Require councils suspend council tax payments for six months: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612558

Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

Suspend VAT on road fuels to reduce fuel costs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610567

People sitting with candles lit no heating as can’t pay for energy. Mental health is already a shambles thanks to covid and this is far worse. Children should not have to worry about parents paying bills and eating. The government has a duty of care to its nation. These companies are making profits beyond belief while we are back to a 1940s standard of living. We need help

attributes.action: Government to tax energy companies to reduce the impact of April's rate increase
attributes.background: The government needs to significantly tax energy firms, energy suppliers and other large multi billion dollar organisations (who currently don't pay any tax, despite every UK hardworking citizen having to pay Tax and NI) to raise funds & plug the hole in electricity & gas prices going up
attributes.additional_details:
The threat looming overhead from energy companies raising their electricity & gas rates by up to 54% has everyone anxious. Such action will force alot or ordinary households in to a state of absolute poverty where they can't decide whether to buy food or heating by winter time. 
It's an absolute disgrace that the Government is sitting idly by & allowing energy companies to enjoy massive profits. BP compared itself to a cash machine making an expected £4bn profit. 
Make energy firms pay, not us!

Give £1000 direct to every household's energy bill for 2022
They have written off £4 billion for fraudulent furlough claims and it will save many going hungry or suffering hypothermia particularly the elderly and vunerable

attributes.action: Ban cryptocurrencies' mining and transactions as action to fight climate change
attributes.background: Carrying out cryptocurrency transactions requires the work of millions of computers calculating each transaction. Just Bitcoin alone consumes 0,46% global electricity production (Yougov, 21.10.2021), more than Argentina usage , or approximately 1/3 of all coal power stations’ production in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
On top of the energy usage, crypto mining requires millions of computers, semiconductors, other equipment which could be needed elsewhere, water for cooling, and space for mining farms. It also has a huge carbon footprint.
Cryptocurrencies enable criminals, drug and arm dealers to make easy, secret money transfers, out of any control. 
Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies made the biggest financial pyramid in history.
Blockchain technology, useful for other purposes, but not investment, should be regulated by government.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601629

attributes.action: Make new building developments run off a minimum of 25% of renewable energy
attributes.background: We want Parliament to introduce a policy to ensure that all future commercial and residential building developments accommodating 50 or more people are powered off a minimum of 25% renewable energy sources.
attributes.additional_details: We want Parliament to help us make a cleaner future for all in the UK. Starting by tackling the biggest users of fossil fuels; larger residential buildings and workplaces. We want this as of 2020, the UK is 76.5% dependent on fossil fuels. This high consumption of damaging resources puts our future in jeopardy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want new buildings to be powered by renewable energy, but we're not sure if you want the Government to require new buildings include renewable power generation, or that energy supplied to building must be from energy suppliers that generate a certain proportion of their energy from renewable sources.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

New planning regulations on all new houses - climate conscious energy supply: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594561

attributes.action: Bring Forward the Ban on Overseas Fossil Fuel Investments
attributes.background: The Government announced a much needed ban on overseas fossil fuel investment to take effect in July. However, this date must be brought forward to halt the 17 projects poised for approval before then. If just one goes ahead, it would be equivalent to producing the CO2 of 500,000 cars each year.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Paris Agreement, fossil fuel projects accounted for 96% of overseas energy investment. This annual spending of £0.85B almost equals that promised in the “Ten Point Plan” (the Government’s  key climate strategy) and this investment must stop now. Strong international policy is desperately needed and we implore the Government to accelerate it’s commitments.

Government Announcement: shorturl.at/mMU48
Projects in consideration: shorturl.at/csA36
Video on climate finance: shorturl.at/cqS67

rejection.details: Since you started your petition the Government has announced that it will no longer provide support for the fossil fuel energy sector overseas from 31 March 2021: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/north-sea-deal-to-protect-jobs-in-green-energy-transition

attributes.background: The government must enforce stronger environmental protection within plans for Covid-19 recovery. attributes.additional_details:
Despite declaring a climate emergency in 2019 the UK Covid-19 recovery plan has an overly strong focus on construction and development at the expense of protecting the natural environment.
Polls show a public preference for a change to the economy and a greener focus, which was promised but quickly forgotten. 
The UK has failed to meet the majority of climate action targets. 
It is our responsibility to protect the natural environment, especially after it has provided us with so many benefits.

This money should be used to fund green energy projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Offshore Wind Sector Deal
The government will work collaboratively with the sector and wider stakeholders to ensure that up to 30GW of offshore wind can be delivered by 2030.

www.gov.uk/government/publications/offshore-wind-sector-deal/offshore-wind-sector-deal

attributes.action: Cap the obscene profits fossil fuel companies make.
attributes.background: The government should directly cap the ludicrous profits fossil fuel companies are making selling oil, gas and coal.
attributes.additional_details:
We pay high energy prices because greedy fossil fuel companies want to make huge profits (Oil profits are over £2.3Bn/ day). 

The current solution - a price freeze puts the country (and countless future generations) into debt. 

We should cap fossil fuel prices and stop paying for fossil fuel companies' greedy profits. 

Profits for retailers (like EON, Octopus etc.) are already capped at 1.9%. The reason our energy bills cost a lot is because fossil fuel companies can charge what they like.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the profits that some companies are making and the impact of high costs on people. However, we're not exactly sure how you'd want a cap on profits to work, or what that cap should be.

The Government has already introduced an Energy Profits Levy, which imposes additional tax on the profits of oil and gas companies, and we could accept a petition calling for changes to how this works.

You can find out more about the Energy Profits Levy here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/cost-of-living-support/energy-profits-levy-factsheet-26-may-2022

attributes.action: Government to legislate for the abolition of Standing Charges on energy & water
attributes.background: Standing charges on energy & water adversely affect the poorest in our society. At a time when energy & water PLCs are making huge profits, paying their senior staff eye-watering salaries & making huge payouts to shareholders this is punitive and immoral. The Government needs stop this injustice
attributes.additional_details: In a cost of living crisis where Energy & Water PLC's are effectively profiteering from the chaos, the least that can be done to help alleviate the cause & effect of this on the public is for Government to legislate to abolish the standing charge. When these PLCs should be addressing core failures in their business model, they are increasing costs & taking handouts. This does not address the issue. People are struggling & as the PLCs can't be trusted to do the right thing this needs intervention

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621561

attributes.action: Repeal the latest budget, it serves big business and the elite not the people
attributes.background:
K Kwarteng's budget must be repealed, the changes only benefit the most wealthy and big business, whilst saddling the public with massive debts. At the least, we must:

* Fund all energy price caps through a windfall tax
* Reinstate 45% the highest tax band
* Reinstate limits on banker bonuses
attributes.additional_details:
K Kwarteng's budget, of Sept 22, will increase the ever widening gap between the rich and poor.

The energy caps should not be paid for by the people, when many big energy companies are making massive profits.

Changes, such as removing the 45% highest income bracket and removing restrictions like banker bonuses, will not boost the economy. They clearly only serve the most wealthy and promote risk taking in the banking sector.

If the Tory party is "leveling-up", this budget fails to deliver.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623684

attributes.action: Run a legally binding referendum into ReNationalising Rail, Mail, Water, Energy
attributes.background: Run a legally binding public referendum on Re-Nationalising our Services such as Rail,Mail,Energy,water and communications
attributes.additional_details:
Vast profits are being stripped out of companies that supply basic infrastructure, while the public and workers pay the price with higher bills and poorer working conditions/pay. 
Majority of these companies/industries were built and funded by rye taxpayer and sold off by successive governments leaving the workers and public worse off. 
Profits made if nationalised would service the U.K. debt and improve quality of lives of the public via investments into local services jobs etc

rejection.details:
Petitions have to set out a clear and specific action for the Government or Parliament to take. While we can see that you'd like the Government to put questions to the public on nationalising certain industries, it's not clear what exactly the referendum would ask. You could start a petition setting out clearly what a referendum would ask voters to decide. 

Separately, you might like to sign this petition calling on the Government "Renationalise all industries that were publicly owned and restrict future sales" - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621537

attributes.action: Restore the Fracking Ban
attributes.background:
The fracking ban was lifted on 22nd September against the wishes of many communities and without addressing the concerns about earth tremors and other issues.
There's no democratic mandate for lifting the ban wasn't in the last Conservative manifesto and it hasn't been approved by Parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
It'll take years for the fracking industry to develop and become economically viable if ever so it won't address the current cost of living crisis.
A large scale fracking industry will destroy swathes of our countryside that we need for growing food, for wildlife and our own wellbeing. 
Instead, we need to focus on developing renewable energy rather than fossil fuels that will pollute the planet and eventually run out.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Keep The Fracking Ban
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

attributes.action: Stop the energy increases,
attributes.background: Support the public and stop the energy increases.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You might also like to be aware of the Government's announcement on 9th September

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-announces-energy-price-guarantee-for-families-and-businesses-while-urgently-taking-action-to-reform-broken-energy-market

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Disable minister expenses completely until energy prices are level with 2021
attributes.background: Prohibit ministers from claiming any form of expenses for the duration of the current energy crisis i.e until energy prices equal those of 2021.All saved expenses should go back into supporting consumers or creating a fund for renewable energy sources or emergencies regarding energy throughout UK
attributes.additional_details:
1) the government should provide a level of support for the population whereby the consumer is largely protected from increased energy prices 
2) it is morally wrong for highly paid ministers to claim expenses while there are members of the population choosing between heating their homes & their families eating 
3) having a fund that is dedicated to renewable home-grown sources of energy and contingency for UK energy would safeguard the population against future energy crises

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses, including expenses claimed by Ministers, and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk

attributes.action: Extend British Summer Time to save the inreased usage of energy .
attributes.background: Domestic energy and Business energy costs increase during darker months because of the shorter daylight hours, by extending BST this problem could be reduced.
attributes.additional_details: Only parliament can bring about this change of law.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want the clocks to change back to GMT later than they currently do, or not at all. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Stop changing the clocks - Keep British Summer Time all year: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612319

attributes.action: Pass law to transfer ownership of energy firms to public by compulsory purchase
attributes.background:
Pass law which allows public to buy all energy firms including gas, electric, petroleum, nuclear and distribution networks.
Part fund the public purchase of energy firms with £11.7bn announced as Energy Bill Support Scheme. If viable, further fund from £37bn announced for Cost of Living Assistance.
attributes.additional_details:
Energy firms are making huge profits, while public is struggling to make ends meet, and energy costs are set to rise even further. 

Guardian reported big oil firms making £200bn/yr (£100bn/6M). Financial Times reported operating earnings of over 40% by distribution networks. In 2016, Competition & Markets Authority suggested that 1.25% margins would provide normal profits, but firms were charging margins of around 4%.

If public owned these firms, then all the profits will flow back to public.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621719

attributes.action: Change the variable Direct Debit policy to prevent abuse by the energy industry
attributes.background: The original intent of the Direct Debit was for inviduals and households to budget according to their requirements.  With the energy crisis and rising caps, we are seeing energy companies significantly increase Direct Debits without consent, seemingly in order to bolster finances. This need to stop.
attributes.additional_details: We urge the Goverment to, at the very least, place strict limits on how much an energy company can raise a monthy Direct Debit amount without consent, and to ensure that the provision to pay bills in full upon issue, is made a mandatory requirement by energy companies and without penalty or levy. This way, the consumer can instead place their energy fund in their own savings accounts and received the interest on their own money.

rejection.details:
The payment methods accepted by energy providers are a matter for them, and not something the UK Government or House of Commons are directly responsible for. 

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

attributes.action: Price cap UK Wholesale Energy prices to pre 2020 levels
attributes.background: Bring an immediate special session of Parliament together to vote on agreeing special and extraordinary measures to immediately price cap UK wholesale energy prices and UK Supplier Energy prices back to pre 2020 levels.
attributes.additional_details:
This will have an immediate impact on UK inflation, interest rates and impending recession and the post brexit UK economy.

UK wholesale energy prices are out of control, with billions of profits being made by a handful of companies at the expense of everyone else.

We can protect vulnerable communities, people on low incomes, working people & businesses from adverse financial hardship.

There is NO JUSTIFICATION for wholesale energy pricing to wreck the UK economy and put more people into debt.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The wholesale price for energy is determined by the cost of producing electricity, and is therefore not something that the UK Government or Parliament can set.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to subsidise the cost of electricity where this exceeds a certain amount (which could be set based on pre-2020 wholesale prices).

attributes.action: Stop All Energy Supplier Companies from Billing Estimated Incorrect Bills...
attributes.background: To stop All Electricity and Gas Supplying Companies here in the UK demanding payment of incorrect,  estimated bills when meter reads have been provided. Customers are vulnerable, elderly or on a low income and receiving inaccurate  bills is particularly traumatic and unhelpful at this time
attributes.additional_details: To legislate that when Meter readings are provided and are correct (whether completed by the customer online,  over the telephone) or by the Contracted Meter Reader that only an Accurate bill  can be Computer  generated allowing All Customers to only pay for the Energy that they are using. If an error has been created ; that All Companies have a dedicated override team that can amend incorrect bills within 10 working days. Many have experienced wait times of  9 months which is unacceptable.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the independent energy regulator, Ofgem.

Ofgem already requires companies to respond to complaints (such as complaints about being overcharged based on inaccurate meter readings) within 8 weeks, and the Energy Ombudsman can examine complaints that haven't been resolved after 8 weeks. 

You can find out how to make a complaint to your energy supplier, and how to contact the Energy Ombudsman, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/making-complaint-about-your-energy-supplier-or-network-operator

attributes.action: Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis through Renewables
attributes.background:
It's a no-brainer. This is the cheapest, quickest, most environmentally friendly, safest, most job-creative way.
- Underwater turbines to harness tidal flows and estuary currents
- Wind farms
- Solar panels farms.
- Battery technology to store energy.
- Insulation of buildings.
attributes.additional_details:
Overseas energy supplies are reducing and costing more. Yet we are not taking this God-given opportunity.  The above approach offers HOPE instead of threatening the environment by investment in more fossil fuel and unsafe nuclear power, as currently planned.
We petition the Government and Parliament to think of the good of our country, our global environment and its people, especially the many poor already affected.  Action, not words, are now urgently needed.  Let the UK lead the way for the world by example.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 
	
We're not exactly sure what specific action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may wish to sign some of these petitions instead: 

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

Introduce grants for home battery storage systems:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610997

Reintroduce Feed-in Tariffs for domestic solar panels:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609063

Create new publicly owned solar energy company to address fuel & climate crisis:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611416

attributes.action: Do more to help face the rising costs of living.
attributes.background: The people of Britain want the government to do more to help face the ridiculous rise in the cost of living. E.g. Green energy sources to bring the energy prices down, reduce the energy cap, reduce the fuel tax, reduce VAT. Increase minimum wage further.
attributes.additional_details: People cannot afford to pay 54% more for their energy, ontop of the increase in fuel, rent, council tax, water, phones and worst of all food.  The people of Britain should not be put in a position where they must chose between their heating and their food. People can't afford to fill their cars to get to and from work. Britain used to be great, now we are heading further and further into poverty!

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the cost of living, however it's not clear what action you want the Government to take regarding 'green energy sources'. Further, the level of the energy price cap is set by Ofgem, the independent regulator for energy markets, not the UK Government. 

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

'Nationalise Energy Companies': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608056

'Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

'Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598785

'Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

'Stop charging VAT on fuel duty': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599411

attributes.action: Reform the entire energy market and invest heavily in renewable energies.
attributes.background:
I propose the government invest heavily and immediately in renewable energies, so gas and electricity prices are independent, and energy is affordable.

Tax electricity providers who generated it using gas.

Investigate why we pay an exorbitant amount for cheap renewable energy.
attributes.additional_details:
Energy prices are going up to ridiculous and unaffordable levels. The government has neglected this for a long time and has to rectify the situation immediately, to prevent people from going into fuel poverty.

It also doesn't make sense that consumers who are with cheap renewable energy companies are paying huge increases because the price of gas has gone up. The government should own part or all of the energy industry so we can invest in renewable energy effectively.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about funding for renewable energy generation, however the Government already provides financial incentives and other forms of funding for such technologies, so it's not clear what it is you'd like the Government to do differently e.g. to invest in the development of renewable energy technologies, or to increase financial incentives to energy companies to build and operate renewable energy generating facilities.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

'Increase UK green energy investment in geothermal sources': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597657

'Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598785

'Require new large buildings include renewable energy generation': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600894

attributes.action: Include Domestic Oil Into the price Cap that exists for Gas and Electricity
attributes.background:
Currently domestic oil prices are 200-300% higher than in 2021. With no legal cap on the price increases. This affects 1.5 million households in the UK.
Domestic Oil prices should come under the same energy cap as Gas and Electricity supply
attributes.additional_details: Include Domestic Oil prices into the same energy cap as enjoyed by Gas and Electricity

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598647

attributes.action: Introduce a new Smart Export Guarantee (SEG) rate option to combat fuel poverty.
attributes.background: Under the SEG, excess energy is usually bought very cheaply by energy providers. This needs to change to help combat fuel poverty. Under the SEG producers should be able to state that they want excess energy to be available to those in fuel poverty rather than resold by energy companies at a profit.
attributes.additional_details: Excess energy from home generators is usually bought by energy providers at very low rates via the SEG, (~5p/kWh) and resold back by them at much higher rates, (~35p/kWh). This needs to change for various reasons. Primarily to support those in, or threatened with fuel poverty. Therefore, The Government and Ofgem should work to introduce an option. Morally and socially we should all be helping to provide a green and independent energy supply for the UK and help alleviate fuel poverty.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

We understand that you're concerned about fuel poverty and the practices of energy companies. However, giving people an option to divert the energy they generate to households in fuel poverty would be an operational matter for energy suppliers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Stop energy suppliers increasing the Standing Charges for domestic fuel.
attributes.background: Cap the Standing Charges at current rates
attributes.additional_details: To stop consumers getting into Fuel poverty more than they are at the moment

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for energy providers.

You can find out more about standing charges here: https://www.energyhelpline.com/help/what-are-unit-rates-and-standing-charges

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a related action:

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

attributes.action: Change SEG to divert excess self generated energy to those who need it.
attributes.background: Many are in fuel poverty and yet many generate their own energy at home. Excess is sold to energy provides at very low rates via the SEG (5p/kWh) and resold back by them at much higher rates, (35p/kWh). This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
Morally this is questionable as many are facing stark choices between energy and food. There is also an element of Energy Security as it places more reliance on the world energy markets.

We should be looking to help those in need and address our own future energy use. It is not an ‘Energy Crisis’, it’s a Usage Crisis.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We understand you're concerned about fuel poverty, but we're not sure what changes you want to the SEG in order to divert energy to households in the way your petition asks for.

attributes.action: Prevent Energy Companies being allowed to double the standard charge
attributes.background: The country has been through a pandemic that has caused great hardship to many households/businesses. People are trying to recover from this, and now they are being given another blow not only with NI increase but this massive hike in utility prices.
attributes.additional_details:
The hike in particular is coming in the standing charge some over 50%. This is not sustainable as wages have not increased. A cap needs to be put in place to reduce this. 
Listening to peoples stories is heartbreaking, do we eat, or keep warm.
April is almost here, and then an October price will be issued, this will be horrendous for the winter months. Many people do not want to be paying back £200 for the next 5 years. This has to be looked at in a sensible. Please act now.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for energy providers.

You can find out more about standing charges here: https://www.energyhelpline.com/help/what-are-unit-rates-and-standing-charges

attributes.action: Increase Russia sanctions coverage: include SWIFT, energy, and investment.
attributes.background:
Extend sanctions to include:
- Swift
- Foreign property assets
- Energy including petroleum
- VISAs
attributes.additional_details: Russia has invaded Ukraine and the current set of sanctions do not go far enough in order for Russia to change its objectives. This petition shows support in the UK public for increasing pressure on Russia, which may increase costs at home, I'm order to show solidarity with Ukrainian citizens who are losing their lives and assets as a result of an invasion. The least we can do is pay a few extra pounds at the petrol station.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609428
